text:
Welcome to How To Cook That, I'm Ann Reardon 
and it's time for another relaxing episode of

miniature cooking 😍 Today I thought we'd make a 
mini box of chocolates, so to start with we are

of course going to need some chocolate. So let's 
unwrap that block and then break it up into little

pieces. I don't actually think this whole block 
will fit into such a small bowl so i'll just get

as much in as i can that will do and now we 
want to microwave that. Now normally i'd say

30 seconds, stir, 30 seconds stir, but this is 
such a tiny amount that it won't take that long.

Then give that a stir to make sure that it is 
all melted then add that melted chocolate onto

the mold. Now these chocolates are going to be so 
tiny that even one air bubble is going to create a

major problem with their shape so once i've spread 
it on as well as i can i'm going to drop it a few

times really hoping to get any air bubbles 
out from inside the molds and up to the top.

Then just use an offset spatula to level off the 
tops, now if you're a long time subscriber then

you'll know that i have a whole series of videos 
on how to make chocolate truffles with heaps of

different fillings for them but i'm not going to 
fill these with anything because they're just too

tiny and while I wait for those to set though 
I might just make something else out of this

leftover chocolate. Let's start by filling 
up a pot with water just turn on that tap

and turn it off and then pop that pan onto the 
stove top. Put the chocolate in a bowl on the

top of the pan and then add some butter to that 
and then give it a stir you want to keep stirring

until all the butter and chocolate is melted 
you could of course do this in the microwave

if you prefer ... that's looking good. Now 
you just want to sift in the flour sifting

the flour just gets rid of the lumps and also 
helps aerate it adds a bit of air to the mixture

and then add in some sugar. Grab your cocoa powder 
put that into the mix and then whisk that together

to make sure it's all mixed in then we want to add 
the eggs 🥚 and I nearly forgot the baking powder

it won't rise without that. Mix it all together 
and then tip that mixture into a lined cake tin

and then put that into the oven to bake. While 
that's baking let's check on the chocolates ...

I don't even know if i'm going to be 
able to get these out of the mold,

I've never attempted to make chocolate 
that's this tiny before ... here we go

oh they're coming out! This one here has a pretty 
bad air bubble in it and so does that one but most

of the others look like they turned out okay so 
now to decorate them. Let's put a tiny stripe of

white chocolate across the top of the square 
ones and we'll give that a second stripe just

going across and some dark chocolate onto some of 
the others. Because these are so tiny it's really

hard to pipe onto them without just piping a blob 
of chocolate that's as big as the chocolate itself

and then i'm going to have to use a knife 
to cut the chocolate stripes in between the

pieces because it's too light just to fall down 
the sides like it normally would at full size.

Now that they're set let's put them into a box. If 
you want to make your own tiny box of chocolates

i'll put the template for this box on the 
howtocookthat.net website for you but be warned

it's really fiddly to fold it is such 
a mini box and then putting chocolates

into it is also very tricky but they do 
look oh so cute when they're all done!

Oh let's not forget about our cake in the 
oven let's get that out and turn off the
heat.

Things cool down fairly quickly when they're this 
small so we can tip it out onto the cooling rack.

Once it's completely cold pop the cake onto a 
plate and sprinkle it with some icing sugar.

Then you just want to cut a slice and serve it up. 
Now some people have said to me because the whole

kitchen is miniature they sometimes forget just 
how small all of this is so for size comparison

here is the box of chocolates next to an ordinary 
fork ... it's really small. This chocolate cake

is very moist and very chocolatey and the recipe 
for it is of course in my Crazy Sweet Creations

cookbook and I'll link you to that below and 
I'll also link you to the playlist of all the

normal size chocolate truffles if you want to make 
a normal box of chocolates rather than a mini one.

I'll leave you with a compilation of some of my 
other mini videos that i've made in the past so

you can enjoy them all in the one place make 
it a great week and i'll see you on Friday.

With thanks to my patrons for all your support. 
In a world where people love to be discouraging

you guys are a breath of fresh air! Make it 
a great week and i'll see you on Friday 😀
